transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: Welcome back. Hope you're hungry this morning because we have a whole lot of fast food.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: We've got quite a spread here. Are you a fast food guy?

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: I try not to eat fast food but every once in a while I get weak.

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: Yes, every once in a while.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: So but the question is what if the calorie counts were posted, would it make a difference for you?

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: Except when it comes to fries.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: Well, starting Monday, McDonald's is going to be posting the calorie count on menus nationwide and under the new U.S. health care law, actually, all restaurants with 20 or more locations will soon be required to do the same thing. So, we have gathered -- our fabulous producer, Troy, has put together this lovely spread and he didn't even eat any of it.

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: No, he didn't. Well, you know, we don't know what was here before, so maybe.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: No, I watched him. I watched him with a close eye.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: All right. So let's start with burgers. OK? We're going to take a look at some of these popular burgers. This one here is the McDonald's Big Mac, favorite of yours, maybe? Not really?

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: Two all-beef patties, special sauce, lettuce, mayo, pickles.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: You're going to sing the song and everything? All right. So, what do you think? I mean, we know it has 1,000 milligrams of sodium.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: But in terms of calories, what is your guess?

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: 515 -- OK, we have to pick it up to find out: whoa, 550.

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: 550, that's a lot for one sandwich. But I was close. I was close.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: All right. Burger King Whopper next.

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: More meat, bigger sandwich, I think, so, I'll put it at 625.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: And that's not to mention the sodium, which is 1,450.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: Not good. OK, next, the Wendy's Baconator. Now, if my husband saw that, that would not even be here anymore. It would be gone in about a split second.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: That's what they say. I wouldn't know, but --

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: Yes, the number really to me doesn't matter when it comes to bacon. I am going to say 800.

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: 970. And I thought I was going high for that one.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: Yes. And guess how much sodium there is in that one?

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: What do you want to look at next? Yes.

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: You want to do the salads or the shakes?

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: OK. Because people think salads are great, that salads are a good idea, but some of these salads really have a lot once you add the dressing and you add all that's here. We have got --

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: McDonald's grilled chicken salad, Caesar salad. So let's see. This, you think, would be a light alternative, a healthy alternative --

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: Oh, 190, I could live with that.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: (Inaudible) lift it too high or we're going to spill it out.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: Another one here, the Burger King grilled chicken -- a lot of these are all grilled chicken Caesar salads.

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: That's a lot for that one. And then the Wendy's grilled chicken Caesar salad here has 770 calories. So, if you think you're getting a light lunch you're doing the right thing, 770 right there.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: Yes, but the problem is, I can see it. I'm looking in --

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: OK, shakes. Let me get to shakes because I love a good shake. McDonald's chocolate shake, 12 ounces, small, 550 calories.

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: And you know people add that on to a meal. We've got the Wendy's chocolate Frosty, love a good Frosty.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: Yes, it looks nice and small, 10 ounces.

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: Yes, so enjoy that one. You'll work that off on the treadmill. And then the Burger King chocolate shake, 12 ounces, 500 calories, again, for a small.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: No way. I'm dropping things all over the place. These are the Taco Bell cinnamon twists. You get a whole bag of these. I'm not even going to tell you what they are, I'm just going to let you eat them.

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: Let's see. They bought these last night.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: Yes, they're not very fresh, 170 calories. -- a little note there.

transcript.speaker: Kaye
transcript.text: So there you go, interesting. It'll certainly make a lot of people think twice.

transcript.speaker: Blackwell
transcript.text: I'm sure they're great when they're fresh, but --
